class.name: RID
class.brief_description: A handle for a [Resource]'s unique identifier.
class.description: The RID [Variant] type is used to access a low-level resource by its unique ID. RIDs are opaque, which means they do not grant access to the resource by themselves. They are used by the low-level server classes, such as [DisplayServer], [RenderingServer], [TextServer], etc. A low-level resource may correspond to a high-level [Resource], such as [Texture] or [Mesh]. [b]Note:[/b] RIDs are only useful during the current session. It won't correspond to a similar resource if sent over a network, or loaded from a file at a later time.

constructor.name: RID
constructor.description: Constructs an empty [RID] with the invalid ID [code]0[/code].

constructor.name: RID
constructor.description: Constructs a [RID] as a copy of the given [RID].

method.name: get_id
method.description: Returns the ID of the referenced low-level resource.

operator.name: operator !=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [RID]s are not equal.

operator.name: operator <
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [RID]'s ID is less than [param right]'s ID.

operator.name: operator <=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [RID]'s ID is less than or equal to [param right]'s ID.

operator.name: operator ==
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if both [RID]s are equal, which means they both refer to the same low-level resource.

operator.name: operator >
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [RID]'s ID is greater than [param right]'s ID.

operator.name: operator >=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [RID]'s ID is greater than or equal to [param right]'s ID.
